meanings.definition: Strength or energy as an attribute of physical action or movement.
meanings.sent1: The strong force of the wind knocked over the tree.
meanings.sent2: She used all her force to push the heavy door open.
meanings.sent3: The force of the water made the boat rock back and forth.
meanings.sent4: The force of his punch was like a hammer hitting a nail.
meanings.sent5: The force of the explosion shook the entire building.

meanings.definition: Coercion or compulsion, especially with the use of violence or threats.
meanings.sent1: The robber used force to make the cashier open the safe.
meanings.sent2: The dictator ruled with an iron fist, using force to suppress dissent.
meanings.sent3: The force of the bully's words made the other kids scared.
meanings.sent4: The force of the law compelled him to pay the fine.
meanings.sent5: The force of the storm forced everyone to seek shelter.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that has a powerful influence.
meanings.sent1: She was a force to be reckoned with in the business world.
meanings.sent2: The mentor became a guiding force in his life.
meanings.sent3: The force of her personality drew people to her.
meanings.sent4: His determination was a driving force behind his success.
meanings.sent5: The force of his argument convinced everyone in the room.
